telegraph.external.cellphonedb
==============================

.. py:module:: telegraph.external.cellphonedb


Functions
---------

.. autoapisummary::

   telegraph.external.cellphonedb.run


Module Contents
---------------

.. py:function:: run(adata: anndata.AnnData, label_col: str, cpdb_file_path: str, counts_data: str = 'hgnc_symbol', output_dir: str | None = None, layer: str | None = None, require_receptor: bool = False, require_ligand: bool = True) -> pandas.DataFrame

   Run CellPhoneDB

   This function runs CellPhoneDB and returns a pandas DataFrame
   with the following columns ['ligand','receptor','target','source','value']

   where source and target indicate the cell type that acts as a source and target of the signal
   (ligand). The value is the CellPhoneDB mean results.
